newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIAN UNEMPLOYMENT RISES TO 12.5 PCT IN DECEMBER.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIAN UNEMPLOYMENT RISES TO 12.5 PCT IN DECEMBER.

text.p: The number of people unemployed
in Bulgaria rose to 478,770 or 12.5 percent of the workforce in
December from 460,061 in November, the National Labour Exchange
(NLE) said.
BULGARIAN UNEMPLOYMENT DEC NOV DEC' 95
pct of workforce 12.5 12.0 11.8
"The month-on-month rise in December was mainly due to a
fall in the number of seasonal job offers and lay-offs in state
enterprises," NLE chairman Milcho Dimitrov told a news
conference.
Bulgaria, hit by a severe economic crisis and preparing for
the introduction of a tough monetary regime, has earmarked 64
loss-making state firms for closure under a funding agreement
with the International Monetary Fund sealed in July.
Restructuring at some of those enterprices had left some
22,000 people jobless in the last quarter of 1996, Dimitrov
said.
The average uneployment rate for last year was 11.1
percent, down 0.3 percentage points on 1995, NLE figures
showed.
A ten percent cut in public service spending targeted in
the 1997 budget draft, yet to be approved by parliamant, was
expected to boost the number of jobless by at least 50,000 this
year, Dimitrov added.
-- Anastas Petrov, Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
